DataElement.preferredName: Pharmacologic Substance Product Material Name Code Change Text ISO21090.ST.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An article other than food intended for use in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease; or intended to affect the structure or any function of the body. EXAMPLE(S): aspirin A character string that is a revision of the original text of the product to enable the coding of the text. EXAMPLE(S): If the original text is "aspriin", the nameCodeModifiedText could be set to "aspirin", so that the text can be successfully coded.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Pharmacologic Substance Product Material Name Code Change Text
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An active natural, synthetic or semi-synthetic ingredient including endogenous body substance that is intended to furnish pharmacological activity or other direct effect in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease or to affect the structure or any function of the human body, but does not include intermediates used in the synthesis of such ingredient (21 CFR 314.3(b)).:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object._The words or language units by which a thing is known.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:The words of something written.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An active natural, synthetic or semi-synthetic ingredient including endogenous body substance that is intended to furnish pharmacological activity or other direct effect in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment, or prevention of disease or to affect the structure or any function of the human body, but does not include intermediates used in the synthesis of such ingredient (21 CFR 314.3(b)).:The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.:The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.

Concepts.definition: Any natural, endogenously-derived, synthetic or semi-synthetic compound with pharmacologic activity. A pharmacologic substance has one or more specific mechanism of action(s) through which it exerts one or more effect(s) on the human or animal body. They can be used to potentially prevent, diagnose, treat or relieve symptoms of a disease. Formulation specific agents and some combination agents are also classified as pharmacologic substances.
The end result of a manufacturing process; anything that is produced.
The tangible substance that goes into the makeup of a physical object.

Property.preferredDefinition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.:The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.:The words of something written.

Concepts.definition: The words or language units by which a thing is known.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
